block.p: Tennessee cornerback Pacman Jones and Cincinnati receiver Chris Henry met separately yesterday with Roger Goodell, the N.F.L. commissioner, as part of the process that could lead to lengthy suspensions for both players because of repeated off-the-field incidents.

Goodell is expected to rule on discipline for Jones and Henry within 10 days. Since he was drafted in 2005, Jones has been arrested five times and questioned by the police in 10 episodes. He could face a felony charge for his role in a melee that led to a triple shooting in a Las Vegas strip club. Henry was arrested four times between December 2005 and June 2006 and has already served a two-game suspension that Goodell issued last season. Goodell is expected to announce a tougher personal-conduct policy before the draft on April 28-29.
